channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No cycling signage defaced damaged missing, 28th October
item.description:
School lane from Bouncers Lane to Three Sisters Lane has defaced, damaged and missing ‘No Cycling’ signs for its full length. These all need replacing and the no cycling enforced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water continually running out of manhole cover and running down Mill Street, 28th October
item.description:
Mill Lane and B4632 junction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mill Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead branch overhanging pavement, 28th October
item.description:
One of the trees on Gloucester Road has a large dead branch overhanging the pavement. When it falls, it would create an obstruction on the pavement or road and could cause injury. Please could you remove it safely? The tree is just next to the bus stop by Lansdown Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling manhole cover on B4633, 28th October
item.description:
The manhole cover on the B4633 Gloucester Road outside Domino's Pizza is loose and rattles every time a vehicle drives over it. Please could you look at this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3x Street lights not working, 28th October
item.description:
Lights located at entrance to Caine Sqaure and Brosnan Drive not working. This is a repeat of continual failures on the same light units located at RHS approach to Caine Square/ Brosnan Drive corner, one at central T junction on approach to Caine Square and one immediately as you turn right into Brosnan Drive. Map location used for nearest available on App.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 27th October
item.description:
The stones out of a pothole are falling down the two drains opposite each other on Millham Road outside No.82. The stones are blocking the drains. Residents are worried this will cause flooding.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 27th October
item.description:
2ft long x foot wide and 4-5 inches. All the tarmacs come out and underneath are big chucks of rocks. As car drive through the pothole they are sending these rocks into the air. This is scratching my car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 27th October
item.description:
Email rcvd (see attached trail) 27.10.23 - The trees are not managed by CBC. They are managed by Highways Gloucestershire (at County level). Again, they are included in this email to contact you directly. You have the common law right to prune branches back to the boundary edge, provided reasonable care of the tree is taken. As the trees are in the Conservation Area, you must notify the Borough Council and await a decision notice prior to works commencing. You can either use the attached form or www.planningportal.co.uk. Kind regards (cont...)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 27th October
item.description:
FMS rcvd 27.10.23 - Blocked drains water running across road. Blocked drains with water running across the road. Two drains are blocked causing surface water on the road and running down Mill St. Would be very dangerous if it froze, it would cause black ice on a busy road.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: 10 potholes all deeper than a tennis ball- These have not been fixed, 27th October
item.description:
We have had a report through saying these have been fixed, as you can see in the j ages, they absolutely have not been fixed. I have also attached the screen shot saying they've been repaired, but they clearly haven't

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 27th October
item.description:
I have noticed a lot of loose edging stones along the section of Ryeworth Road by the railings. I worry that they might fall on someone or end up through a car window. Please can the be secured as soon as possible. Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The stretch of Innsworth Lane from the building sites up to the Hare and Hounds is absolutely filthy. The curbs are thick with mud from the site and with the addition of rain becoming a problem. The corners of side roads are thick with mud by the drains creating an additional problem. There are no road cleaners at any time at this end of Innsworth Labe., 27th October
item.description:
From the new building site, in front of the barracks and all the way up to the Hare and Hounds. The problem also runs the other way along Innsworth Lane too. The trucks are a relentless annoyance throughout the day and creating a filthy problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing no entry sign Brunswick St Cheltenham, 27th October
item.description:
The no entry sign is missing from the post at the junction of St Paul's Road and Brunswick Street, adjacent to 56 St Paul's Road. The number on the post is 117644
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 27th October
item.description:
Hi My name is Katie, and I am a property manager for some areas on the above estate, on my site inspection today I noticed a drain cover missing. This isn’t on a part of land we manage, so I thought I would notify you as this could be a serious trip hazerd (please see attached photo). It near to the front entrance of 21A (it’s along a path), see area circled below.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 27th October
item.description:
email rcvd - Good Afternoon, As discussed on the phone, please see attached the photos of the suspected collapsed drain outside Trumans Cottage Manor Lane, Gotherington, GL52 9QX. Please note, the water is also going into the property via the front wall as attached Thank you
Report on FixMyStreet
